titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brower v. Miller court decision 1977.617
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:45:38 +0000.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York (State). Criminal Court (New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: A decision issued in the case of case of Abraham Brower v. Charles Miller, tried in New York State Criminal Court in New York City, regarding the enticement of an indentured servant from the original master.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brower v. Miller court decision, 1977.617, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
